What is the purpose of the Auxiliary Lubrication System?
Answers: To protects the FDGS journal bearings from low oil pressure conditions in windmilling operation
To provide correct oil flow to the Fan Drive Gear System and the No. 3 Bearing
To controls oil flow to the No. 3 Bearing damper

Questions.QuestionString: What is the function of the Fuel/Oil Heat Exchanger Bypass Valve (FOHEBV)?
Answers: To control and distribute oil flow between two pathways based on fuel temperature
To direct the oil to journal bearings, ensuring their lubrication at low power setting
To controls oil flow to the No. 3 Bearing damper

Questions.QuestionString: The Oil Debris Monitoring (ODM) sensor
Answers: Sends signals proportional to the size and type of the pollution particles to the HMU
Sends signals proportional to the size and type of the pollution particles to the EIU
Sends signals proportional to the size and type of the pollution particles to the PHMU

The Main Oil Temperature (MOT) sensor is a dual channel sensor and is used to
Answers: Measure the temperature of the scavenge oil returning to the tank
Measure the temperature of the lubrication oil pressure from the tank
Measure the pressure of the scavenge oil returning to the tank

Questions.QuestionString: The No. 4 bearing magnetic chip collector is located
Answers: The lubrication and scavenge oil pump, at the 6 o'clock position
In the No. 4 bearing oil scavenge line

Answers: Detects any type of pollution that crossed its electromagnetic field
